question: Among the given pair of vectors, the resultant of two vectors can never be 3 units. The vectors are
explanation: The resultant of two vectors <katex>$A$</katex> and <katex>$B$</katex> lies between <katex>$|A-B|$</katex> and <katex>$A+B$</katex>.
For (4, 8): Range is <katex>$[8-4, 8+4] = [4, 12]$</katex>. 3 is not in this range.
